en: What should I bring?
zh: 我该带什么？

en: What did you make?
zh: 你做了什么？

en: A penny for your thoughts.
zh: 你在想什么？

en: What do you think you're doing?
zh: 你以为你在做什么？

en: How about telling me what you have in mind?
zh: 不如告诉我你在想什么？

en: What are you thinking about?
zh: 你在想什么？

en: Not knowing what to say, he remained silent.
zh: 不知道该说什么，他保持沉默。

en: Not knowing what to say, she remained silent.
zh: 不知道该说什么，她保持沉默。

en: I'm at a loss for what to say.
zh: 我不知道该说什么。

en: What to say is more important than how to say it.
zh: 说什么比怎么说更重要。

en: What do you mean?
zh: 你是什么意思？

en: Not knowing what to see, I asked him for advice.
zh: 不知道该看什么，我向他请教。

en: What are you going to see?
zh: 你打算去看什么？

en: No matter what he plays on the screen, Tom looks great.
zh: 无论他在屏幕上播放什么，汤姆看起来都很棒。

en: What will you have to drink?
zh: 你想喝点什么？

en: No matter what you do, do your best.
zh: 无论你做什么，都要尽力而为。

en: It's no use trying anything.
zh: 尝试任何事情都没用。

en: What are you about?
zh: 你是做什么的？

en: I wonder what they have in store for us under the big top?
zh: 我想知道他们会在大帐篷下为我们准备什么？

en: My view is different from his as to what should be done.
zh: 对于应该做什么，我的观点和他不同。

en: Why are you so happy?
zh: 你为什么这么高兴？

en: What makes you so sad?
zh: 什么让你这么难过？

en: In doing anything, do your best.
zh: 做任何事情，都要尽力而为。

en: Whatever you do, carry it through.
zh: 无论你做什么，都要坚持到底。

en: And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men.
zh: 无论做什么，都要从心里做，像是为主做的，不是为人做的。

en: Kyoto is famous for its shrines and temples.
zh: 京都以神社和寺庙而闻名。

en: Kyoto is most beautiful in autumn.
zh: 京都秋天最美。

en: Kyoto is most crowded when it is most beautiful.
zh: 京都最美的时候也最拥挤。

en: Kyoto is famous for its old temples.
zh: 京都以古老的寺庙而闻名。

en: Kyoto is internationally famous for its scenic beauty.
zh: 京都以其美丽的景色在国际上闻名。

en: Kyoto depends on the tourist industry.
zh: 京都依赖旅游业。

en: Kyoto was the former capital of Japan.
zh: 京都是日本以前的首都。

en: Kyoto is visited by many tourists.
zh: 京都吸引了许多游客。

en: Kyoto was an old capital of Japan.
zh: 京都是日本的古都。

en: How do you like Kyoto?
zh: 你觉得京都怎么样？

en: Kyoto is visited by many people every year.
zh: 京都每年都有很多人来参观。

en: Kyoto is worth visiting once.
zh: 京都是值得一游的。

en: The charm of Kyoto consists of the beauty of its old temples.
zh: 京都的魅力在于其古老寺庙的美丽。

en: There was an enormous traffic jam in downtown Kyoto.
zh: 京都市中心发生了严重的交通堵塞。

en: Are you from Kyoto?
zh: 你是京都人吗？

en: Summers are very hot in Kyoto.
zh: 京都的夏天非常炎热。

en: Don't forget to give us a ring when you arrive in Kyoto.
zh: 你到达京都的时候，别忘了给我们打个电话。

en: He acted as a guide while I was staying in Kyoto.
zh: 我住在京都的时候，他担任我的导游。

en: I would often visit the museum when I lived in Kyoto.
zh: 我住在京都的时候，经常去博物馆。

en: There are many famous old buildings in Kyoto.
zh: 京都有很多著名的古老建筑。

en: A heavy snow fell in Kyoto for the first time in ages.
zh: 京都下了多年来第一场大雪。

en: There are many places to visit in Kyoto.
zh: 京都有很多值得参观的地方。

en: Kyoto has many universities.
zh: 京都有很多大学。

en: There are many shrines in Kyoto.
zh: 京都有很多神社。

en: Have you been to Kyoto?
zh: 你去过京都吗？

en: What do you say to taking a walk by the seaside?
zh: 去海边散步怎么样？

en: There is no reason to wear a suit to the beach.
zh: 没有理由穿着西装去海滩。

en: Which way is the beach?
zh: 去海滩怎么走？

en: Seaside resorts, such as Newport, are very crowded in summer.
zh: 像纽波特这样的海滨度假胜地，夏天非常拥挤。

en: They went to the beach.
zh: 他们去海滩了。

en: There were few people on the beach.
zh: 海滩上几乎没有人。

en: Paul's family spends the summer at the coast every year.
zh: 保罗一家每年夏天都在海边度过。

en: We'll have a barbecue at the beach.
zh: 我们将在海滩上烧烤。

en: I saw a fishing boat about a mile off the shore.
zh: 我看到一艘渔船在离岸大约一英里的地方。

en: You will benefit by a trip abroad.
zh: 出国旅行对你会有好处。

en: Would you like to travel abroad?
zh: 你想出国旅行吗？

en: Traveling abroad is one of my favorite things.
zh: 出国旅行是我最喜欢的事情之一。

en: Traveling abroad is now more popular.
zh: 出国旅行现在越来越受欢迎。

en: I had a chance to travel abroad.
zh: 我有一个出国旅行的机会。

en: I've been invited on a trip abroad, but I don't want to go.
zh: 我被邀请出国旅行，但我不想去。

en: Traveling abroad is out of the question.
zh: 出国旅行是不可能的。

en: Unfair tariffs are imposed on foreign products.
zh: 不公平的关税被强加于外国产品。

en: Canada is a good place to go if it's your first experience living abroad.
zh: 如果这是你第一次在国外生活，加拿大是个好去处。

en: Overseas food exports are one of the mainstays of agribusiness.
zh: 海外食品出口是农业综合企业的主要支柱之一。

en: It's going to be six dollars because it's international.
zh: 因为是国际的，所以要六美元。

en: When you travel abroad, you usually need a passport.
zh: 出国旅行时，通常需要护照。

en: The number of students going abroad to study is increasing each year.
zh: 每年出国留学的学生人数都在增加。

en: More and more couples go on honeymoon trips abroad.
zh: 越来越多的夫妇出国度蜜月。

en: The number of Japanese going overseas has been increasing year by year.
zh: 日本人出国的人数逐年增加。

en: The number of students going abroad is on the increase.
zh: 出国留学的学生人数正在增加。

en: The Sumida is not a good river for us to swim in any more.
zh: 隅田川已经不再适合我们游泳了。

en: Could we have a table in the corner?
zh: 我们可以在角落里要一张桌子吗？

en: Don't leave it up to chance.
zh: 不要碰运气。

en: The man in the corner addressed himself to the husband.
zh: 角落里的那个人对丈夫说话。

en: I met her by accident.
zh: 我偶然遇到了她。

en: By chance we saw him as he came out of the shop.
zh: 我们碰巧看到他从商店里出来。

en: It just so happened that Mr Yamada came from the same town.
zh: 碰巧山田先生来自同一个城镇。

en: It is true that he did it, whether by accident or by design.
zh: 他的确做了这件事，不管是偶然还是故意的。

en: What a coincidence!
zh: 真是太巧了！

en: I just came up with the word.
zh: 我刚想到这个词。

en: I found the book by accident.
zh: 我偶然发现了这本书。

en: I found that restaurant by accident.
zh: 我偶然发现了那家餐馆。

en: I met her by chance.
zh: 我偶然遇到了她。

en: I happened to witness the bullying in the corridor.
zh: 我碰巧目睹了走廊里的霸凌事件。

en: By chance, I met her in the street.
zh: 偶然地，我在街上遇到了她。

en: By chance I met my ex-girlfriend in Portugal.
zh: 我在葡萄牙偶然遇到了我的前女友。

en: It happened that I saw my friend walking in the distance.
zh: 碰巧我看到我的朋友在远处走着。

en: Even times odd is even, odd times odd is odd.
zh: 偶数乘以奇数是偶数，奇数乘以奇数是奇数。

en: The sky promises fair weather.
zh: 天空预示着好天气。

en: The sky looks angry.
zh: 天空看起来很阴沉。

en: Judging from the look of the sky, it will be fine tomorrow.
zh: 从天空的样子判断，明天会是好天气。

en: Judging from the look of the sky, it may rain at any moment.
zh: 从天空的样子判断，可能随时会下雨。

en: Judging from the look of the sky, we may have snow tomorrow.
zh: 从天空的样子判断，明天可能会下雪。

en: Judging from the look of the sky, it is going to snow.
zh: 从天空的样子判断，要下雪了。

en: Judging from the look of the sky, it may rain this afternoon.
zh: 从天空的样子判断，今天下午可能会下雨。

en: What made her so sad?
zh: 什么事让她这么伤心？

en: What do you play baseball for?
zh: 你打棒球是为了什么？

en: Why did her father go to Japan?
zh: 她父亲为什么去日本？

en: What on earth do you want six copies of the same book for?
zh: 你到底要六本同样的书干什么？

en: What are you working for?
zh: 你在为谁工作？

en: What did you buy this expensive dictionary for?
zh: 你买这本昂贵的词典是为了什么？

en: What do you learn English for?
zh: 你学英语是为了什么？

en: What did you buy it for?
zh: 你买它干什么？

en: For what?
zh: 为了什么？

en: What kind of sandwich do you want?
zh: 你想要哪种三明治？

en: What for?
zh: 为什么？

en: The allusion was not lost on me.
zh: 我明白这个典故。

en: What will you have to eat?
zh: 你想吃什么？

en: Just tell me what you'd like me to do.
zh: 告诉我你想让我做什么就行。

en: I will be glad if I can serve you in any way.
zh: 如果我能以任何方式为您服务，我将很高兴。

en: In fact, I'll even call George at the office and tell him he ought to come home and help out.
zh: 事实上，我甚至会打电话给乔治，告诉他他应该回家帮忙。

en: What a fine day it is!
zh: 今天天气真好！

en: What a good teacher Mr Hirayama is!
zh: 平山先生真是个好老师！

en: How well Mr Hirayama teaches!
zh: 平山先生教得真好！

en: What a dishonest fellow!
zh: 多么不诚实的人啊！

en: What a beautiful rainbow!
zh: 多么美丽的彩虹啊！

en: What lovely flowers!
zh: 多么可爱的花啊！

en: I don't know how to reply to that question.
zh: 我不知道如何回答这个问题。

en: What a big supermarket!
zh: 多么大的超市啊！

en: What a lazy teacher!
zh: 多么懒惰的老师啊！

en: His diligence earned him success.
zh: 他的勤奋为他赢得了成功。

en: Industrious people look down on laziness.
zh: 勤奋的人鄙视懒惰。

en: A diligent man will succeed in the long run.
zh: 勤奋的人终将成功。

en: In the end, the diligent person succeeds.
zh: 最终，勤奋的人会成功。

en: Some boys are diligent, others are idle.
zh: 有些男孩很勤奋，有些则很懒惰。

en: His diligence and good conduct earned him the scholarship.
zh: 他的勤奋和良好品行为他赢得了奖学金。

en: She became rich by virtue of hard work and good business sense.
zh: 她凭借努力工作和良好的商业头脑而致富。

en: Hard work has brought him where he is.
zh: 努力工作使他达到了今天的成就。

en: Diligence may compensate for lack of experience.
zh: 勤奋可以弥补经验的不足。

en: Hard work enabled him to succeed.
zh: 努力工作使他能够成功。

en: It goes without saying that diligence is a key to success.
zh: 不用说，勤奋是成功的关键。

en: Needless to say, diligence is a key to happiness.
zh: 不用说，勤奋是幸福的关键。

en: Slight inattention can cause a great disaster.
zh: 稍有疏忽可能会酿成大祸。

en: I gave him what little money I had.
zh: 我把他仅有的一点钱都给了他。

en: Tears came into my eyes when I was chopping onions.
zh: 我切洋葱的时候，眼泪都出来了。

en: Don't go to extremes.
zh: 不要走极端。

en: Don't go to extremes. To be moderate is important in anything.
zh: 不要走极端。凡事适度很重要。

en: He does not, in short, write with the candor of a man who is completely confident of his thesis.
zh: 简而言之，他写作时并不像一个完全相信自己论点的人那样坦率。

en: Even the smallest worm will turn if trodden on.
zh: 即使是最小的虫子，被踩到也会反抗。

en: The habits of highly intelligent people offer a clue as to how to do that.
zh: 高智商人士的习惯为我们如何做到这一点提供了线索。

en: It's a long road with no curves.
zh: 这是一条没有弯路的漫长道路。

en: Though imperfectly, he finished writing his manuscript.
zh: 虽然不完美，但他还是完成了手稿的写作。

en: I'll give you a local anaesthetic.
zh: 我会给你局部麻醉。

en: I have an itch in my pubic area.
zh: 我的耻骨区域发痒。

en: The director wanted the local Asahi reporter to go to the scene of the crime.
zh: 导演希望当地的朝日新闻记者去犯罪现场。

en: My vacation went by quickly.
zh: 我的假期过得真快。

en: The vacation came to an end all too soon.
zh: 假期结束得太快了。

en: My wife and I agreed on a holiday plan.
zh: 我和我妻子就度假计划达成了一致。

en: Tell me what you did on your holidays.
zh: 告诉我你假期做了什么。

en: Have you made up your mind where to go for the holidays?
zh: 你决定好去哪里度假了吗？

en: Would you look after my children while I am away on vacation?
zh: 我度假的时候，你能帮我照顾一下孩子吗？

en: When I go on vacation, I'll rent a car.
zh: 我度假的时候，会租一辆车。

en: Do you sometimes go abroad on your holidays?
zh: 你有时会出国度假吗？

en: She was very brown after her holiday.
zh: 她度假回来后，皮肤晒得很黑。

en: When the vacation is over, I will catch up with a lot of work.
zh: 假期结束后，我要补上很多工作。

en: When I return from vacation, I shall have to catch up with a lot of work.
zh: 我度假回来后，要补上很多工作。

en: May I take a rest?
zh: 我可以休息一下吗？

en: Who is absent?
zh: 谁缺席了？

en: Stand at ease!
zh: 稍息！

en: Will this cover the holiday expenses?
zh: 这能负担度假的费用吗？

en: Where are you going to go on your vacation?
zh: 你打算去哪里度假？

en: He is lively during recess.
zh: 课间休息时他很活跃。

en: Taking a little time off?
zh: 休息一下吗？

en: I did nothing during the holidays.
zh: 假期我什么也没做。

en: There are many tourists in the city on holidays.
zh: 假期期间，城市里有很多游客。

en: What do you usually do on holidays?
zh: 你通常在假期做什么？

en: In her leisure time, she enjoys swimming and tennis.
zh: 她空闲时喜欢游泳和打网球。

en: Please come and see us sometime during the vacation.
zh: 假期的时候，请来我们这里看看。

en: Do you feel like resting?
zh: 你想休息一下吗？

en: Too much rest is rust.
zh: 休息过多会生锈。

en: Here is your bag.
zh: 这是你的包。

en: I took your umbrella by mistake.
zh: 我不小心拿了你的伞。

en: You'll get into trouble if your girlfriend finds out the truth.
zh: 如果你女朋友发现真相，你会有麻烦的。

en: Your mother is in critical condition.
zh: 你母亲情况危急。

en: Your mother must have been beautiful when she was young.
zh: 你母亲年轻的时候一定很漂亮。

en: We came on account of your sick mother.
zh: 我们因为你母亲生病才来的。

en: I think your father hoped you would go to college.
zh: 我想你父亲希望你能上大学。

en: I'd like to see your father.
zh: 我想见见你的父亲。

en: Your sister looks as noble as if she were a princess.
zh: 你姐姐看起来很贵气，像个公主一样。

en: Is your uncle still abroad?
zh: 你叔叔还在国外吗？

en: What does your aunt do?
zh: 你阿姨是做什么的？

en: Where does your uncle live?
zh: 你叔叔住在哪里？

en: Thanks to your help, I could succeed.
zh: 多亏了你的帮助，我才能成功。

en: Thanks to you, the job went well.
zh: 多亏了你，工作进展顺利。

en: Thanks to you, I spent all my money.
zh: 多亏了你，我把所有的钱都花光了。

en: Your essay is admirable in regard to style.
zh: 你的文章在文风方面令人钦佩。

en: I have no idea what you mean.
zh: 我不知道你在说什么。

en: I'm tired of your everlasting grumbles.
zh: 我厌倦了你没完没了的抱怨。

en: Your chair is identical to mine.
zh: 你的椅子和我的完全一样。

en: I believe you.
zh: 我相信你。

en: While I understand what you say, I can't agree with you.
zh: 虽然我明白你说的，但我不能同意你的观点。

en: I don't agree with you.
zh: 我不同意你的观点。

en: Is your apartment well maintained?
zh: 你的公寓维护得好吗？

en: Your idea cannot be brand new. I heard about it from another source last year.
zh: 你的想法不可能是全新的。我去年从其他地方听说过。

en: Your idea is definitely worth thinking about.
zh: 你的想法绝对值得考虑。

en: Democracy is the worst form of government, except all the others that have been tried.
zh: 民主是最糟糕的政府形式，除了所有其他尝试过的形式。

en: When you're beginning to look like the photo in your passport, you should go on a holiday.
zh: 当你开始长得像护照上的照片时，你应该去度假了。

en: It wasn't me, commissioner!
zh: 不是我，警官！

en: Oh, my white pants! And they were new.
zh: 哦，我的白裤子！而且还是新的。

en: With so many people around he naturally became a bit nervous.
zh: 周围有这么多人，他自然变得有点紧张。

en: When I left the train station, I saw a man.
zh: 当我离开火车站时，我看到了一个人。

en: You're an angel!
zh: 你真是个天使！

en: People from Madrid are weird.
zh: 马德里人很奇怪。

en: Well, the night is quite long, isn't it?
zh: 嗯，夜晚还很长，不是吗？

en: You're lucky because he didn't bite you.
zh: 你很幸运，因为他没有咬你。

en: Did you miss me?
zh: 你有没有想我？

en: Are they all the same?
zh: 他们都一样吗？

en: Thank you very much!
zh: 非常感谢！

en: Where are the eggs, please?
zh: 请问，鸡蛋在哪里？

en: I'll take him.
zh: 我带走他。

en: It's a surprise.
zh: 这是一个惊喜。

en: That's a good idea!
zh: 真是个好主意！

en: Round trip? Only one-way.
zh: 往返票？只要单程票。

en: It's a pity when somebody dies.
zh: 有人去世真是太可惜了。

en: Damn! It's not bad!
zh: 该死！还不赖嘛！

en: Pull into shape after washing.
zh: 洗后拉伸定型。

en: Wash before first wearing.
zh: 首次穿着前请清洗。

en: Don't open before the train stops.
zh: 列车未停稳前请勿打开。

en: Those who live in glass houses should not throw stones.
zh: 住在玻璃房子里的人不应该扔石头。

en: They say love is blind.
zh: 人们说爱情是盲目的。

en: I'll be right back.
zh: 我马上回来。

en: I'll be back in a jiffy.
zh: 我一会儿就回来。

en: I'll be back right away.
zh: 我立刻回来。

en: I'll return immediately.
zh: 我立刻回来。

en: I'll be back shortly.
zh: 我很快回来。

en: I don't know.
zh: 我不知道。

en: I don't know what to say.
zh: 我不知道该说什么。

en: I don't know what I should say.
zh: 我不知道我应该说什么。

en: What should I say?
zh: 我该说什么？

en: Is that a recent photo?
zh: 那是最近的照片吗？

en: I don't know if there is time.
zh: 我不知道有没有时间。

en: For some reason the microphone didn't work earlier.
zh: 不知道为什么，刚才麦克风没用。

en: You need not telephone me.
zh: 你不用给我打电话。

en: Brian repeatedly told Chris that he owed him a pretty large amount of money.
zh: 布莱恩反复告诉克里斯，他欠了他一大笔钱。

en: How dare you say such a thing to me?
zh: 你竟敢对我说这样的话？

en: You ask me to do the impossible.
zh: 你让我做不可能的事。

en: I make 100 euros per day.
zh: 我每天赚100欧元。

en: I may give up soon and just take a nap.
zh: 我可能很快就会放弃，然后睡个午觉。

en: That's because you don't want to be alone.
zh: 那是因为你不想一个人。

en: That sort of thing won't happen.
zh: 那种事不会发生。

en: It isn't going to happen.
zh: 这不会发生的。

en: He's strange sometimes.
zh: 他有时候很奇怪。

en: Don't worry about it!
zh: 别担心！

en: Don't worry about it.
zh: 别担心。

en: Don't worry.
zh: 别担心。

en: Do you believe war will start?
zh: 你相信会发生战争吗？

en: You should follow your teacher's advice.
zh: 你应该听从你老师的建议。

en: You ought to ask for your teacher's permission.
zh: 你应该请求你老师的允许。

en: You may as well ask for your teacher's advice.
zh: 你还不如问问你老师的建议。

en: You ran a red light.
zh: 你闯红灯了。

en: You should swear on the Bible.
zh: 你应该对着圣经发誓。

en: You must cultivate your mind.
zh: 你必须修身养性。

en: Can you eat raw oysters?
zh: 你能吃生蚝吗？

en: You are made to be a poet.
zh: 你是天生的诗人。

en: You seem an honest man.
zh: 你看上去是个诚实的人。

en: You seem to be an honest man.
zh: 你看上去是个诚实的人。

en: You didn't have to dress.
zh: 你不必打扮。

en: You have to get this work finished by noon.
zh: 你必须在中午之前完成这项工作。

en: I should think you are right.
zh: 我想你是对的。

en: You may be right, but I am against your opinion.
zh: 你可能是对的，但我反对你的意见。

en: Are you concerned with politics?
zh: 你关心政治吗？

en: You can get ahead in the world.
zh: 你可以在社会上取得成功。

en: He is ignorant of the world.
zh: 他不懂世事。

en: You will find it stated a few pages further on.
zh: 你会发现它在后面几页有说明。

en: Are you fond of swimming?
zh: 你喜欢游泳吗？

en: You will soon get used to speaking in public.
zh: 你很快就会习惯在公共场合讲话。

en: You must not lose sight of your goal in life.
zh: 你千万不要忘记你的人生目标。

en: You were kind to help me.
zh: 你真好，帮助了我。

en: Can you break away from your parents?
zh: 你能脱离你的父母吗？

en: Do you believe in God?
zh: 你相信上帝吗？

en: There is a garden at the back of my house.
zh: 我家后面有一个花园。

en: After tying up loose ends on the house, the carpenter gave the painter approval to begin work.
zh: 木匠处理完房子的一些零碎工作后，批准油漆工开始工作。

en: There is a hut at the back of our house.
zh: 我们家后面有一个小屋。

en: Our dog buries its bones in the garden.
zh: 我们的狗把骨头埋在花园里。

en: Please wait outside of the house.
zh: 请在房子外面等候。

en: Our living room is sunny.
zh: 我们的客厅阳光明媚。

en: There are always some chores to be done about the house.
zh: 总有一些家务活要做。

en: Our family consists of five members.
zh: 我们家有五口人。

en: The rise in house prices enabled him to sell his house at a big profit.
zh: 房价上涨使他能够以高额利润出售他的房子。

en: The side of the house was covered with ivy.
zh: 房子的侧面覆盖着常春藤。

en: Please go around to the side of the house.
zh: 请绕到房子的侧面。

en: The homeless sought shelter from the chilly shower.
zh: 无家可归的人在寒冷的阵雨中寻找避难所。

en: The homeless people were annoyed by the flies and mosquitoes.
zh: 无家可归的人被苍蝇和蚊子困扰。

en: I was almost home when the car ran out of gas.
zh: 我快到家的时候，车没油了。

en: This side of the house catches the morning sun.
zh: 房子的这一面能照到早晨的阳光。

en: The oven in my house didn't run well today.
zh: 我家的烤箱今天不太好用。

en: There was a large garden behind the house.
zh: 房子后面有一个大花园。

en: She scraped her shoes clean before she entered the house.
zh: 她进屋前把鞋子刮干净。

en: It is our custom to take off our shoes when we enter the house.
zh: 我们有进屋脱鞋的习惯。

en: Can you deliver it to my house?
zh: 你能把它送到我家吗？

en: Investing money in your home has some merit; when it is time to sell it you can get more money.
zh: 把钱投资在你的房子里是有好处的；当要卖掉它的时候，你可以得到更多的钱。

en: On arriving home, he laid himself on the floor.
zh: 一到家，他就躺在地板上。

en: Scarcely had I reached home before the telephone rang.
zh: 我刚到家，电话就响了。

en: When I got home, I found your letter waiting for me.
zh: 我到家时，发现你的信在等我。

en: It was not until I reached home that I missed my purse.
zh: 直到我到家才发现我的钱包不见了。

en: I'll foot the bill.
zh: 我来付账。

en: The bill amounts to 500 dollars.
zh: 账单总额是五百美元。

en: I paid the bill out of my expense account.
zh: 我用我的报销账户支付了账单。

en: Business is business.
zh: 公事公办。

en: Charge this bill to me.
zh: 把这笔账记在我头上。

en: The bills are all done by computers.
zh: 账单都是用电脑处理的。

en: The bill amounted to 500 dollars.
zh: 账单总额是五百美元。

en: The bill amounts to five thousand yen.
zh: 账单总额是五千日元。

en: The cold wind cut me to the bone.
zh: 寒风刺骨。

en: A cold spell gripped Europe.
zh: 一股寒流袭击了欧洲。

en: A cold wave passed over Japan.
zh: 一股寒潮席卷了日本。

en: The thermometer went down below zero.
zh: 温度计降到了零度以下。

en: Thermometers often go below zero.
zh: 温度计经常降到零度以下。

en: I have a chill.
zh: 我有点冷。

en: I feel cold.
zh: 我感觉冷。

en: I have very bad chills.
zh: 我感到非常冷。

en: Don't you feel cold?
zh: 你不觉得冷吗？

en: Making nothing of the cold, he went out in thin clothes.
zh: 他不怕冷，穿着单薄的衣服就出去了。

en: I don't mind the cold, but I can't stand the heat.
zh: 我不怕冷，但我受不了热。

en: The warmth after the chills intoxicated us.
zh: 寒冷过后的温暖让我们陶醉。

en: Some plants are quickly affected by cold.
zh: 有些植物很快就会受到寒冷的影响。

en: I do feel the cold.
zh: 我确实感到冷。

en: The cold soon penetrated his quilted jacket.
zh: 寒冷很快就穿透了他的棉袄。

en: I feel cold. Do you mind closing the window?
zh: 我感觉冷。你介意关上窗户吗？

en: As the day got cooler, I had to put on a sweater.
zh: 随着天气变凉，我不得不穿上毛衣。

en: Compare your composition with the example.
zh: 把你的作文和范文比较一下。

en: Your English composition is above the average.
zh: 你的英语作文高于平均水平。

en: Your composition was good except for the spelling.
zh: 你的作文很好，只是有些拼写错误。

en: Your composition leaves nothing to be desired.
zh: 你的作文完美无缺。

en: Your composition is very good, and it has few mistakes.
zh: 你的作文很好，只有几个错误。

en: Your composition is as good as ever.
zh: 你的作文一如既往地好。

en: Your composition is perfect except for a few mistakes.
zh: 你的作文近乎完美，只有几个小错误。

en: Your composition is free from all grammatical mistakes.
zh: 你的作文没有任何语法错误。

en: There are few mistakes in your composition.
zh: 你的作文里几乎没有错误。

en: Your essay has some mistakes, but as a whole it is very good.
zh: 你的文章有一些错误，但总的来说非常好。

en: Your composition has a few mistakes.
zh: 你的作文有一些错误。

en: When talking about your last results, it is dependent on the last examination.
zh: 当谈到你上次的成绩时，这取决于上次的考试。

en: Explain to him the difficult situation you are in.
zh: 向他解释你所处的困境。

en: The trouble with you is that you talk too much.
zh: 你的问题在于你话太多了。

en: What you have said doesn't apply to you.
zh: 你所说的不适用于你。

en: Do you eat rice in your country?
zh: 你们国家吃米饭吗？

en: You should come early in order for him to read your manuscript before your speech.
zh: 你应该早点来，以便他在你演讲前阅读你的手稿。

en: Your conduct is perfectly legal.
zh: 你的行为完全合法。

en: Your conduct doesn't become a gentleman.
zh: 你的行为不像一个绅士。

en: Your behavior is in conflict with your principles.
zh: 你的行为与你的原则相悖。

en: Your behavior is quite out of place.
zh: 你的行为很不合时宜。

en: Your behavior is too extraordinary.
zh: 你的行为太出格了。

en: Your behavior admits of no excuse.
zh: 你的行为无可辩解。

en: Your behavior leaves much to be desired.
zh: 你的行为令人不敢恭维。

en: You are not consistent in your actions.
zh: 你的行为前后不一致。

en: The council began at 9:00 and should be finished by 10:45.
zh: 会议9点开始，应该在10点45分结束。

en: Fix a date for the meeting.
zh: 确定会议日期。

en: Guess what the managing director started off the meeting by saying. The first thing out of his mouth was an announcement of some major restructuring.
zh: 猜猜总经理在会议开始时说了什么。他说的第一件事就是宣布一些重大的结构调整。

en: At the meeting he monopolized the discussion and completely disrupted the proceeding.
zh: 在会议上，他垄断了讨论，完全扰乱了会议进程。

en: The chairman of the meeting became ill.
zh: 会议主席生病了。

en: Please note the change in the meeting agenda.
zh: 请注意会议议程的变更。

en: The agenda for the meeting has been distributed.
zh: 会议议程已经分发了。

en: It would help us if you would reserve the following hotel during our conference.
zh: 如果您能在我们开会期间预订以下酒店，将对我们有所帮助。

en: Taking notes at each meeting is one of the official duties.
zh: 在每次会议上做笔记是官方职责之一。

en: I had a little chat with John after the meeting.
zh: 会议结束后，我和约翰聊了一会儿。

en: Did he show up at the meeting?
zh: 他出席会议了吗？

en: Sorry I'm late for the meeting.
zh: 抱歉，我开会迟到了。

en: Are you going to attend the meeting?
zh: 你要参加会议吗？

en: I came to Tokyo to attend a conference.
zh: 我来东京参加一个会议。

en: Attend the meeting.
zh: 参加会议。

en: Those present at the meeting supported the bill.
zh: 出席会议的人支持这项法案。

en: Few people attended the meeting.
zh: 很少有人参加会议。

en: Let's hurry to be in time for the meeting.
zh: 我们快点去，以便及时赶上会议。

en: Only a few people showed up on time for the meeting.
zh: 只有少数人准时参加了会议。

en: I can't attend the meeting.
zh: 我不能参加会议。

en: How many people were present at the meeting?
zh: 有多少人出席了会议？

en: His proposals were adopted at the meeting.
zh: 他的提案在会议上被采纳了。

en: You have to raise your hand if you want to speak at the meeting.
zh: 如果你想在会议上发言，你必须举手。

en: When Kawazoe pinned me down at the meeting, I broke out in a cold sweat.
zh: 当川添在会议上抓住我不放时，我吓出了一身冷汗。

en: I was asked to put away all the papers we used at the meeting.
zh: 我被要求收拾好我们在会议上使用的所有文件。

en: Has a change in ocean currents occurred?
zh: 海洋洋流是否发生了变化？

en: Mountains in the ocean and even whole ranges are still being discovered, and most of them have not yet been explored in detail.
zh: 海洋中的山脉，甚至是整个山脉，仍在被发现，而且大多数尚未进行详细的探索。

en: Voyages of exploration were the earliest in the history of studying the ocean.
zh: 考察航行是研究海洋历史上最早的。

en: If we are to judge the future of ocean study by its past, we can surely look forward to many exciting discoveries.
zh: 如果我们要根据过去来判断海洋研究的未来，我们当然可以期待许多激动人心的发现。

en: Driving along the coast is wonderful.
zh: 沿着海岸开车真是太棒了。

en: The seaside is an ideal spot for the children to play.
zh: 海边是孩子们玩耍的理想场所。

en: The air by the sea is pure and healthy.
zh: 海边的空气清新健康。

en: I am taking a holiday at the beach.
zh: 我正在海滩度假。

en: Mr Kaifu is used to making speeches in public.
zh: 李开复先生习惯于在公共场合发表演讲。

en: Low-lying lands will flood. This means that people will be left homeless and their crops will be destroyed by the salt water.
zh: 低洼地带将被淹没。这意味着人们将无家可归，他们的庄稼将被盐水摧毁。

en: We want to explore an underwater oil field.
zh: 我们想勘探一个水下油田。

en: A submarine cable was laid between the two countries.
zh: 两国之间铺设了一条海底电缆。

en: The pirates had no choice but to surrender.
zh: 海盗别无选择，只能投降。

en: The pirates buried their treasure in the ground.
zh: 海盗把他们的宝藏埋在地下。

en: Larger pirates often preyed on unarmed merchant ships.
zh: 较大的海盗经常掠夺手无寸铁的商船。

en: Let's make believe that we're pirates.
zh: 让我们假装我们是海盗。

en: The pirates sailed the seven seas.
zh: 海盗航行于七大洋。

en: This is the first time I've had seaweed.
zh: 这是我第一次吃海藻。

en: A sailor frequently has no time to get his sea legs after leaving port before a battle starts.
zh: 水手经常在离开港口后还没来得及适应海上生活，战斗就开始了。

en: The seawater stings my cut.
zh: 海水刺痛了我的伤口。

en: He met his friend while bathing in the sea.
zh: 他在海里游泳时遇到了他的朋友。

en: There was a violent storm at sea.
zh: 海上有一场猛烈的风暴。

en: Kaishuu made nothing of hardship.
zh: 胜海舟不把艰辛放在眼里。

en: It seems the navy jets had a major screw-up in navigation and they bombed their own troops by mistake.
zh: 看来海军喷气机在导航上犯了一个重大错误，他们错误地轰炸了自己的部队。

en: A short stroll along the beach gave me a good appetite for breakfast.
zh: 沿着海滩散步一小会儿，让我对早餐有了好胃口。

en: You did well to keep the secret.
zh: 你保守秘密做得很好。

en: Whether you like her or not, you can't marry her.
zh: 不管你喜不喜欢她，你都不能娶她。

en: I don't know whether you like her or not.
zh: 我不知道你是否喜欢她。

en: It is not good that you did not ask her name.
zh: 你没有问她的名字是不好的。

en: It is cruel of you to find fault with her.
zh: 你挑她的毛病太残忍了。

en: What you said to her isn't accepted as a joke.
zh: 你对她说的那些话不能被当成玩笑接受。

en: Either you or she has to go there.
zh: 要么你去那里，要么她去那里。

en: As you have insulted him, he is cross with you.
zh: 因为你侮辱了他，所以他对你很生气。

en: We thought it wrong that you should punish him.
zh: 我们认为你不应该惩罚他是错误的。

en: It is no use your waiting for him.
zh: 你等他也没用。

en: It is no use your trying to persuade him.
zh: 你试图说服他也没用。

en: Does he know that you love him?
zh: 他知道你爱他吗？

en: Imagine yourself to be in his place.
zh: 想象一下你自己在他的位置上。

en: You did well not to follow his advice.
zh: 你没有听从他的建议做得很好。

en: It was foolish of you to accept his offer.
zh: 你接受他的提议太愚蠢了。

en: You did wrong to refuse his help.
zh: 你拒绝他的帮助是错误的。

en: Either you or he is wrong.
zh: 要么你错了，要么他错了。

en: Either you or he has to attend the meeting.
zh: 要么你参加会议，要么他参加会议。

en: It was wise of you to ask him for help.
zh: 你向他寻求帮助是明智的。

en: You are quite justified in answering him back.
zh: 你回击他是完全有道理的。

en: Whatever you said to him made him feel better.
zh: 无论你对他说什么，都让他感觉好多了。

en: I can't approve of your going out with him.
zh: 我不赞成你和他出去。

en: I cannot approve of your going out with him.
zh: 我不赞成你和他出去。

en: I don't approve of your going out with him.
zh: 我不赞成你和他出去。

en: Either you are right or he is.
zh: 要么你是对的，要么他是对的。

en: Come off it!
zh: 得了吧！

en: The nuclear family makes better communication possible between parents and children.
zh: 核心家庭使得父母和孩子之间能够进行更好的沟通。

en: Let's get discount tickets.
zh: 我们去弄打折票吧。

en: The expansion is aging.
zh: 这个扩展包已经过时了。

en: I'm going to make enlarged copies.
zh: 我要制作放大版的复印件。

en: Round-trip fares to each destination are as follows.
zh: 到每个目的地的往返票价如下。

en: The top favorites of each section were gathered together.
zh: 每个部分中最受欢迎的都被聚集在一起。

en: Each room is equipped with large desks.
zh: 每个房间都配备有大型书桌。

en: PTAs in various places are discussing school regulations.
zh: 各地家长教师协会正在讨论学校规章制度。

en: Each party shall consist of not less than fifteen people.
zh: 每一方应由不少于十五人组成。

en: Each generation would have to rediscover for itself the truths of the past.
zh: 每一代人都必须自己重新发现过去的真理。

en: Each person has his own way of doing things.
zh: 每个人都有自己做事的方式。

en: Each speaker was allotted five minutes.
zh: 每位发言者被分配了五分钟。

en: Each man's pay will be in proportion to his work.
zh: 每个人的工资将与其工作成比例。

en: Each man's pay was in proportion to his work.
zh: 每个人的工资与其工作成比例。

en: The more unique each person is, the more he contributes to the wisdom of others.
zh: 每个人越独特，他就越能为他人的智慧做出贡献。

en: Each man must cast a vote.
zh: 每个人都必须投一票。

en: The lack of harmony between colors makes this painting stand out.
zh: 颜色之间的不和谐使这幅画脱颖而出。

en: It has been demonstrated in various researches that the private sector has little influence over policy making.
zh: 各种研究表明，私营部门对政策制定几乎没有影响。

en: The different character typologies are represented schematically in figure one.
zh: 不同的性格类型在图一中以示意图的形式表示。

en: Go to your respective seats.
zh: 回到你们各自的座位。

en: Each of us has to be careful when driving.
zh: 我们每个人开车时都必须小心。

en: Go to your posts.
zh: 去你们的岗位。

en: Every nation has its peculiar character.
zh: 每个国家都有其独特的性格。

en: Each country has its own customs.
zh: 每个国家都有自己的风俗习惯。

en: Please take off your shoes.
zh: 请脱鞋。

en: Please remove your shoes before entering the house.
zh: 请进屋前脱鞋。

en: I bought a pair of shoes.
zh: 我买了一双鞋。

en: Give my shoes a good shine.
zh: 把我的鞋擦亮。

en: The shoelace came untied.
zh: 鞋带开了。

en: Your shoes need brushing. They are muddy.
zh: 你的鞋需要刷一下，太脏了，都是泥。

en: Shoes are stiff when they are new.
zh: 新鞋很硬。

en: Shoes are sold in pairs.
zh: 鞋是成双出售的。

en: Where're the shoes?
zh: 鞋在哪里？

en: You must keep your shoes clean.
zh: 你必须保持鞋子干净。

en: How soon can I have my shoes mended?
zh: 我的鞋多久能修好？

en: Tie your shoelaces.
zh: 系好你的鞋带。

en: Gum got stuck to the bottom of my shoe.
zh: 口香糖粘在我的鞋底了。

en: The soles of my shoes are worn.
zh: 我的鞋底磨损了。

en: Brush off the dust from your shoes.
zh: 把鞋上的灰尘刷掉。

en: What size shoes do you wear?
zh: 你穿多大码的鞋？

en: My shoes hurt. I'm in agony.
zh: 我的鞋子很疼，我难受死了。

en: Your feet are swollen because your shoes are too small.
zh: 你的脚肿了，因为你的鞋太小了。

en: Please remove the mud from your shoes.
zh: 请把鞋上的泥弄掉。

en: I'd like some shoes.
zh: 我想要买些鞋。

en: My shoes are worn out.
zh: 我的鞋穿坏了。

en: The shoes are worn out.
zh: 这鞋穿坏了。

en: These shoes are too tight. They hurt.
zh: 这鞋太紧了，穿着疼。

en: It's a catch.
zh: 这是一个圈套。

en: I would rather die than live in dishonor.
zh: 我宁愿死也不愿苟且偷生。

en: You have done very well.
zh: 你做得非常好。

en: You are, so to speak, a fish out of water.
zh: 可以这么说，你就像是如鱼离水。

en: You are now among the elite.
zh: 你现在身处精英阶层。

en: When did you come to Japan?
zh: 你什么时候来日本的？

en: When will you leave here?
zh: 你什么时候离开这里？

en: You are at liberty to leave any time.
zh: 你可以随时自由离开。

en: When will you be free?
zh: 你什么时候有空？

en: When did you begin studying English?
zh: 你什么时候开始学英语的？

en: You are always as busy as a bee.
zh: 你总是像蜜蜂一样忙碌。

en: You're always criticizing me!
zh: 你总是批评我！

en: You always like to trip me up, don't you?
zh: 你总是喜欢绊倒我，不是吗？

en: You're always finding fault with me.
zh: 你总是挑我的毛病。

en: You always take things too easy.
zh: 你总是把事情想得太简单。

en: You are always complaining.
zh: 你总是抱怨。

en: You are always wearing a loud necktie.
zh: 你总是戴着一条花哨的领带。

en: You are always the cause of my worries.
zh: 你总是让我担心。

en: You're always anticipating trouble.
zh: 你总是杞人忧天。

en: You always excuse your faults by blaming others.
zh: 你总是归咎于别人来为自己的错误辩解。

en: You always insist that you are in the right.
zh: 你总是坚持自己是对的。

en: You are always doubting my word.
zh: 你总是怀疑我说的话。

en: You are always finding fault with me.
zh: 你总是挑我的毛病。

en: You always talk back to me, don't you?
zh: 你总是顶撞我，是不是？

en: What time do you usually get up?
zh: 你通常几点起床？

en: What time do you usually go to bed?
zh: 你通常几点睡觉？

en: You are always watching TV.
zh: 你总是看电视。

en: I'm glad we didn't go there because there were some localized heavy rain showers.
zh: 我很高兴我们没去那里，因为那里有一些局部地区的强降雨。

en: We decided to branch out into selling some foodstuffs.
zh: 我们决定扩展业务，开始销售一些食品。

en: An accomplishment cannot be looked upon as yours unless you paddled your own canoe.
zh: 除非是你自己努力奋斗得来的，否则一项成就不能被认为是你的。

en: A delivery man is dropping off an arrangement of artificial flowers.
zh: 一个送货员正在送来一束人造花。

en: Fair competition is necessary for the healthy growth of industry.
zh: 公平竞争是工业健康发展的必要条件。

en: Turn on your back.
zh: 翻过身去，仰面朝上。

en: You startled me!
zh: 你吓我一跳！

en: Amazingly, the old man recovered his health.
zh: 令人惊奇的是，这位老人恢复了健康。

en: To my astonishment, my money was gone.
zh: 令我惊讶的是，我的钱不见了。

en: Between astonishment and sorrow, she could not speak a word.
zh: 她又惊又悲，说不出一句话。

en: I was too astonished to speak.
zh: 我太惊讶了，说不出话来。

en: Astonishment deprived me of speech.
zh: 惊讶得我说不出话来。

en: I was too surprised to speak.
zh: 我太惊讶了，说不出话来。

en: The vase on my desk overturned when I jumped up in surprise.
zh: 我惊讶地跳起来时，我桌子上的花瓶被打翻了。

en: Her eyes become round in surprise.
zh: 她的眼睛因惊讶而睁大了。

en: I stared back at her in surprise.
zh: 我惊讶地回望着她。

en: I start in surprise.
zh: 我吓了一跳。

en: To my surprise, she was alive.
zh: 令我惊讶的是，她还活着。

en: To my surprise, she could not answer the question.
zh: 令我惊讶的是，她无法回答这个问题。

en: To my surprise, there were no people in the village.
zh: 令我惊讶的是，村子里没有人。

en: To my surprise, the child came here by himself all the way from Yokohama.
zh: 令我惊讶的是，这个孩子竟然独自一人从横滨一路来到这里。

en: It's astonishing, the size of his head.
zh: 真令人吃惊，他的头真大。

en: What a surprise!
zh: 真令人惊讶！

en: I found, to my surprise, that she was dead.
zh: 令我惊讶的是，我发现她已经死了。

en: To his surprise, she was nowhere in sight, and he wondered if she had returned home alone.
zh: 令他惊讶的是，她不见踪影，他想知道她是否独自回家了。

en: I'll come again when you are free.
zh: 等你空闲的时候，我会再来的。

en: It's no use your saying anything.
zh: 你说什么都没用。

en: Whatever you may say, you won't be believed.
zh: 无论你说什么，你都不会被相信。

en: Say what you will, he won't accept your invitation.
zh: 随你怎么说，他都不会接受你的邀请。

en: I haven't the faintest idea what you mean.
zh: 我完全不知道你在说什么。

en: It matters little what you do.
zh: 你做什么都无关紧要。

en: I do not mind what you do.
zh: 我不介意你做什么。

en: Whatever you say, I'll marry her.
zh: 无论你说什么，我都要娶她。

en: Say what you will, I will act on my own judgement.
zh: 随你怎么说，我会按自己的判断行事。

en: No matter what you say, he still won't do it.
zh: 无论你怎么说，他还是不会做的。

en: Whatever you may say, I don't believe you.
zh: 无论你怎么说，我都不相信你。

en: It's good to talk things over before you buy something.
zh: 买东西之前好好商量一下是好事。

en: I wish you were close to me.
zh: 我希望你能在离我近的地方。

en: It was bad of you to get angry at your wife.
zh: 你不该对你妻子发脾气。

en: Your refusal to help complicated matters.
zh: 你不肯帮忙使事情变得复杂了。

en: I can no more speak French than you can speak English.
zh: 我不会说法语，就像你不会说英语一样。

en: What is the main purpose of your studying English?
zh: 你学习英语的主要目的是什么？

en: If you could only speak English, you would be perfect.
zh: 如果你能说英语就好了，你就完美了。

en: It's evident that you told a lie.
zh: 很明显，你说了谎。

en: What is that thing in your right hand?
zh: 你右手拿着的是什么东西？

en: Would you mind making an extra cup of coffee whenever you decide to have some?
zh: 如果你要喝咖啡，能不能顺便帮我多做一杯？

en: It seems as if you are the first one here.
zh: 好像你是第一个到的。

en: It is risky for you to go into that area alone.
zh: 你独自去那个地区是很危险的。

en: I enjoyed the holiday all the better for being with you.
zh: 因为和你在一起，我更喜欢这个假期。

en: As long as you stick to one style, you can't hit upon a wonderful idea.
zh: 只要你坚持一种风格，你就不会产生绝妙的想法。

en: You are prohibited from smoking here.
zh: 禁止在此吸烟。

en: What ever are you doing here?
zh: 你到底在这里做什么？

en: How long did it take you to drive from here to Tokyo?
zh: 你从这里开车到东京花了多长时间？

en: You had better get away from here at once.
zh: 你最好立刻从这里离开。

en: You've drunk three cups of coffee.
zh: 你已经喝了三杯咖啡了。

en: Have you had any experience with this kind of work?
zh: 你有没有做过这种工作？

en: You have to study hard to catch up with your class.
zh: 你必须努力学习才能赶上你的班级。

en: You must be mentally exhausted.
zh: 你一定是精神疲惫了。

en: You'll certainly pass the coming exam.
zh: 你肯定会通过即将到来的考试。

en: Not only you but also I was involved.
zh: 不仅你，我也参与其中。

en: Where are you from in Canada?
zh: 你是加拿大的哪里人？

en: You will catch cold.
zh: 你会感冒的。

en: Since you have a cold, you must not go out.
zh: 既然你感冒了，就不要出门了。

en: You ought to have taken your father's advice.
zh: 你本应该听你父亲的劝告。

en: You ought to take your father's advice.
zh: 你应该听取你父亲的建议。

en: You may as well follow your father's advice.
zh: 你最好听从你父亲的建议。

en: Have you visited the town where your father was born?
zh: 你去过你父亲出生的城镇吗？

en: You should ask your father for his advice and follow it.
zh: 你应该向你父亲请教并听从他的建议。

en: You should apologize to Dad for not coming home in time for supper.
zh: 你应该为没有及时回家吃晚饭向爸爸道歉。

en: Have you ever visited the office where your father works?
zh: 你去过你父亲工作的办公室吗？

en: You don't get up as early as your sister.
zh: 你没有你姐姐起得早。

en: You look just like your big brother.
zh: 你看起来很像你哥哥。

en: You haven't any money.
zh: 你没有钱。

en: Haven't you got any money?
zh: 你没钱吗？

en: Aren't you happy?
zh: 你不高兴吗？

en: Let's sing a happy song.
zh: 咱们唱首快乐的歌吧。

en: My happy schooldays will soon be behind me.
zh: 我快乐的校园生活很快就要结束了。

en: Let's sing some merry songs.
zh: 咱们唱些欢快的歌吧。

en: Have a nice summer vacation.
zh: 祝你暑假愉快。

en: Wishing you a Halloween filled with fun.
zh: 祝你万圣节充满乐趣。

en: It's our pleasure.
zh: 这是我们的荣幸。

en: It's been nice talking to you, but I really must go now.
zh: 很高兴和你聊天，但我真的得走了。

en: She can express her feelings when she feels happy or sad.
zh: 她感到高兴或悲伤时，能够表达自己的感受。

en: Pleasure is the source of pain.
zh: 快乐是痛苦的根源。

en: The head of the college, whose name was Miss Baker, therefore had a special place in the car park for her own small car.
zh: 学院的院长，名叫贝克小姐，因此在停车场为她自己的小汽车留了一个特殊的位置。

en: Scholarship must always be exact whether it is interesting or not.
zh: 学术研究必须始终精确，无论它是否有趣。

en: There is no easy road to learning.
zh: 学习没有捷径。

en: Without hesitating, the dean selects infinite wisdom.
zh: 院长毫不犹豫地选择了无限的智慧。

en: He was at a loss as to which faculty to choose.
zh: 他不知该选择哪个院系。

en: I'll rely on my father for half of my tuition.
zh: 我学费的一半要靠我父亲。

en: The pupils burst out laughing.
zh: 学生们哄堂大笑。

en: The president addressed his students as follows.
zh: 校长向学生们发表了如下讲话。

en: The school uniform is convenient because it can be worn for both informal and formal occasions.
zh: 校服很方便，因为它既可以用于非正式场合，也可以用于正式场合。

en: They hate him because he gives them a mountain of homework.
zh: 他们讨厌他，因为他给他们布置了堆积如山的作业。

en: The students volunteered for community service.
zh: 学生们自愿参加社区服务。

en: The students were animated by the agitator's appeal.
zh: 煽动者的话激励了学生们。

en: The students sat still, listening to the lecture.
zh: 学生们静静地坐着，听着讲座。

en: The students demonstrated against the new government.
zh: 学生们示威游行，反对新政府。

en: The students are busy preparing for the examination.
zh: 学生们正忙着准备考试。

en: The students are having a recess now.
zh: 学生们现在正在休息。

en: Too long a holiday makes one reluctant to start work again.
zh: 假期太长会让人不想重新开始工作。

en: The holiday continues to be very boring.
zh: 这个假期仍然非常无聊。

en: I'm dying to see Kumiko.
zh: 我非常想见到久美子。

en: Kumi did not talk about her club.
zh: 久美没有谈论她的社团。

en: Hearing this song after so long really brings back the old times.
zh: 这么久之后听到这首歌，真的让人回忆起过去的美好时光。

en: After a long absence he came back.
zh: 他离开很久之后回来了。

en: An old friend of mine dropped in on me for the first time in ages.
zh: 一位老朋友很久之后第一次来拜访我。

en: It's been so long since we've met, let's have a drink or two and talk about the good old days.
zh: 我们很久没见了，喝一两杯，聊聊过去的美好时光吧。

en: I haven't seen him for a long time.
zh: 我很久没见到他了。

en: Please forgive me for not having written for a long time.
zh: 请原谅我很久没有写信了。

en: Will Mr Oka teach English?
zh: 冈先生会教英语吗？

en: After running up the hill, I was completely out of breath.
zh: 跑上山后，我完全喘不过气来。

en: The hills are bathed in sunlight.
zh: 山丘沐浴在阳光下。

en: The hill lay covered with snow.
zh: 山丘覆盖着积雪。

en: The hill slopes downward to the river.
zh: 山丘向下倾斜到河流。

en: The hill was all covered with snow.
zh: 山丘上覆盖着积雪。

en: The hill glows with autumnal colors.
zh: 山丘闪耀着秋天的色彩。

en: The hill is always green.
zh: 山丘总是绿色的。

en: You see a white building at the foot of the hill.
zh: 你在山脚下看到一座白色的建筑物。

en: The wind blew harder yet when we reached the top of the hill.
zh: 当我们到达山顶时，风刮得更大了。

en: The building which stands on the hillside is our school.
zh: 坐落在山坡上的那栋建筑是我们的学校。

en: A castle stands a little way up the hill.
zh: 一座城堡矗立在山坡上不远处。

en: Our school on the hill commands a full view of Mt. Fuji.
zh: 我们山上的学校可以俯瞰富士山的景色。

en: The building on the hill is our school.
zh: 山上的那栋建筑是我们的学校。

en: The old church on the hill dates back to the twelfth century.
zh: 山上的那座古老的教堂可以追溯到十二世纪。

en: You're my type.
zh: 你是我喜欢的类型。

en: You're irresistible.
zh: 你太迷人了。

en: Could you call again later, please?
zh: 请你晚点再打来，好吗？

en: Who am I talking with?
zh: 请问我和谁说话呢？

en: Smile now, cry later!
zh: 先笑后哭！

en: At the age of six he had learned to use the typewriter and told the teacher that he did not need to learn to write by hand.
zh: 他六岁的时候就学会了使用打字机，并告诉老师他不需要学习手写。

en: Life is beautiful.
zh: 生活是美好的。

en: He doesn't want you to tell him about your sex life.
zh: 他不想你告诉他你的性生活。

en: Have you ever eaten a banana pie?
zh: 你吃过香蕉派吗？

en: Why would you marry a woman if you like men?
zh: 如果你喜欢男人，为什么要娶女人呢？

en: Are you for or against abortions?
zh: 你支持还是反对堕胎？

en: What made you change your mind?
zh: 是什么让你改变了主意？

en: It's a pity that you can't buy miracles like you would buy potatoes.
zh: 可惜你不能像买土豆一样买到奇迹。

en: I love lasagna.
zh: 我喜欢千层面。

en: This baby penguin is too cute!
zh: 这只小企鹅太可爱了！

en: I'm at the hospital. I got struck by lightning.
zh: 我在医院。我被闪电击中了。

en: What is your greatest source of inspiration?
zh: 你最大的灵感来源是什么？

en: You don't marry someone you can live with — you marry the person whom you cannot live without.
zh: 你不是和一个可以一起生活的人结婚，而是和一个你不能没有的人结婚。

en: In theory, there is no difference between theory and practice. But, in practice, there is.
zh: 理论上，理论和实践没有区别。 但是，在实践中，存在差异。

en: Don't stay in bed, unless you can make money in bed.
zh: 不要赖在床上，除非你能在床上赚钱。

en: Anything that is too stupid to be spoken is sung.
zh: 任何蠢到不能说出口的东西都会被唱出来。

en: It requires wisdom to understand wisdom: the music is nothing if the audience is deaf.
zh: 理解智慧需要智慧：如果听众是聋子，音乐就毫无意义。

en: I was rereading the letters you sent to me.
zh: 我正在重读你寄给我的信。

en: I don't want to go to school.
zh: 我不想去上学。

en: It's over between us. Give me back my ring!
zh: 我们之间结束了。把我的戒指还给我！

en: You are watching TV all the time.
zh: 你老是看电视。

en: You are always hearing but not listening.
zh: 你总是听而不闻。

en: You are quite a man.
zh: 你真是个了不起的人。

en: Once you begin, you must continue.
zh: 一旦开始，就必须继续。

en: You can always ask a question in return.
zh: 你总是可以反问一个问题。

en: What on earth are you talking about?
zh: 你到底在说什么啊？

en: You will know the truth some day.
zh: 总有一天你会知道真相的。

en: Some day you will have to reap the harvest of your own sowing.
zh: 总有一天你必须自食其果。

en: How long have you been living in Kobe, then?
zh: 那你已经在神户住了多久了？

en: How long have you been alienated from your family?
zh: 你和家人疏远多久了？

en: You are naughty.
zh: 你真淘气。

en: How much money do you want?
zh: 你想要多少钱？

en: You have some books.
zh: 你有一些书。

en: You've given me good advice.
zh: 你给了我很好的建议。

en: You are a good boy.
zh: 你是个好孩子。

en: You need not to have called me up so late at night.
zh: 你没必要这么晚打电话给我。

en: You must be tired after such a long trip.
zh: 经过这么长的旅行，你一定很累了吧。

en: You shouldn't talk back to your parents like that.
zh: 你不应该那样顶撞你的父母。

en: You shouldn't talk back like that.
zh: 你不应该那样顶嘴。

en: You shouldn't have eaten so much ice cream.
zh: 你不应该吃那么多冰淇淋。

en: You are right in a way.
zh: 你在某种程度上是对的。

en: Have you ever been to America?
zh: 你去过美国吗？

en: You had better not work too hard.
zh: 你最好不要工作太努力。

en: You don't exert yourself much.
zh: 你不太努力。

en: You are too much letter-bound.
zh: 你太拘泥于书本了。

en: Are you able to type?
zh: 你能打字吗？

en: You must not rely upon such a man.
zh: 你可不能依靠那样的人。

en: You may think those shoes are in fashion, but they aren't.
zh: 你可能觉得那些鞋子很时髦，但它们并不时髦。

en: You had better not repeat such an error.
zh: 你最好不要再犯这样的错误。

en: You must not depend so much on others.
zh: 你不要太依赖别人。

en: You need not have hurried so much.
zh: 你本不必那么着急的。

en: You need not have come here so early.
zh: 你本不必这么早来的。

en: You don't need to worry about such a thing.
zh: 你不用担心那种事。

en: You shouldn't do such a thing.
zh: 你不应该做那样的事。

en: You are old enough to know better than to act like that.
zh: 你都这么大了，应该知道那样做是不对的。

en: You are not to do that.
zh: 你不准那样做。

en: It is impossible for you to do so.
zh: 你不可能做到。

en: You ought not to have done such a thing.
zh: 你本不该做那样的事。

en: You shouldn't have done such a thing.
zh: 你真不该做那样的事。

en: You may as well keep it a secret.
zh: 你还不如把它保密。

en: You can bank on that.
zh: 你可以相信这一点。

en: Who did you give it to?
zh: 你把它给谁了？

en: You could have done it.
zh: 你本来可以做到的。

en: Were you to take it back?
zh: 你要是把它拿回去呢？

en: Have you finished it?
zh: 你做完了吗？

en: Do you have one?
zh: 你有一个吗？

en: You can see it, but you cannot take it away.
zh: 你可以看到它，但你不能拿走它。

en: You will wish you had never seen it.
zh: 你会后悔看到它的。

en: You must practice it at regular intervals.
zh: 你必须定期练习它。

en: Did you buy it on the black market?
zh: 你是在黑市买的吗？

en: Hurry up, and you'll be in time for school.
zh: 快点，这样你就能赶上上学了。

en: Hurry, help.
zh: 快，救命啊。

en: Hurry up. You'll be late for school.
zh: 快点，你上学要迟到了。

en: Hurry up, or you will miss the train.
zh: 快点，不然你会错过火车的。

en: Come on! We're going to be late.
zh: 快点！我们要迟到了。

en: Hurry up, or you will miss the last train.
zh: 快点，不然你会错过末班车的。

en: Hurry up, or you will be late for the last train.
zh: 快点，不然你赶不上末班车了。

en: There seems no need to hurry.
zh: 似乎没有必要着急。

en: We needn't have hurried.
zh: 我们本不必那么着急的。

en: You don't have to hurry.
zh: 你不必着急。

en: There is no hurry; you have five days to think the matter over.
zh: 不用着急，你有五天的时间来考虑这件事。

en: There's no hurry.
zh: 不用着急。

en: We didn't need to hurry.
zh: 我们没必要那么着急。

en: Let's hurry up.
zh: 我们快点吧。

en: Hurry up, or you'll be late for school.
zh: 快点，不然你上学要迟到了。

en: Hurry up, and you can catch the train.
zh: 快点，你就能赶上火车了。

en: Hurry up, or you will be late.
zh: 快点，不然你要迟到了。

en: You will miss the train if you don't hurry.
zh: 如果你不快点，你就会错过火车的。

en: Hurry up, or you won't catch up with him.
zh: 快点，不然你就赶不上他了。

en: Hurry up! The concert is starting.
zh: 快点！音乐会要开始了。

en: Hurry up, or you'll miss the bus.
zh: 快点，不然你会错过公共汽车的。

en: Hurry up, or you will be late for school.
zh: 快点，不然你上学要迟到了。

en: Hurry up, or we'll miss the train.
zh: 快点，不然我们会错过火车的。

en: Hurry up, and you will be on time.
zh: 快点，你就能及时赶到。

en: Hurry up, or you'll miss your plane.
zh: 快点，不然你会错过飞机的。

en: A fire broke out on the fifth floor.
zh: 五楼发生了火灾。

en: A fire may happen at any moment.
zh: 随时可能发生火灾。

en: The fire took 13 lives.
zh: 这场火灾夺走了13条生命。

en: In case of fire, ring the bell.
zh: 如果发生火灾，请按铃。

en: Break this glass in case of fire.
zh: 发生火灾时，请打破这块玻璃。

en: In case of fire, dial 119.
zh: 发生火灾时，请拨打119。

en: In case of fire, press this button.
zh: 发生火灾时，请按此按钮。

en: In case of fire, you should dial 119.
zh: 如果发生火灾，你应该拨打119。

en: In case of a fire, use this emergency stairway.
zh: 如果发生火灾，请使用此紧急楼梯。

en: In case of a fire, use the steps.
zh: 如果发生火灾，请走楼梯。

en: Please use this exit when there is a fire.
zh: 发生火灾时，请使用此出口。

en: In case of fire, break the glass and push the red button.
zh: 发生火灾时，打破玻璃并按下红色按钮。

en: In the case of fire, dial 119.
zh: 发生火灾时，请拨打119。

en: The cause of the fire is not known.
zh: 火灾原因不明。

en: The cause of the fire was his cigarette butt.
zh: 火灾的原因是他的烟头。

en: There is not much doubt about the cause of the fire.
zh: 关于火灾的原因，几乎没有疑问。

en: The cause of the fire was known.
zh: 火灾的原因已经查明。

en: In case of fire, telephone the fire station.
zh: 如果发生火灾，请打电话给消防队。

en: In case of fire, break this window.
zh: 发生火灾时，打破这扇窗户。

en: I lost my shoe in the fire.
zh: 我在火灾中丢了一只鞋。

en: When the fire broke out, he was dead asleep.
zh: 火灾发生时，他正在熟睡。

en: Half of the town burnt down in the fire.
zh: 镇上一半的房屋在火灾中被烧毁。

en: The fire deprived us of our property.
zh: 这场火灾剥夺了我们的财产。

en: The fire consumed the whole building.
zh: 大火吞噬了整栋建筑物。

en: The fire caused a panic in the theater.
zh: 火灾引起了剧院的恐慌。

en: We won the game by three goals to one.
zh: 我们以三比一赢得了比赛。

en: Our team can easily beat your team in the first game.
zh: 我们的队伍在第一场比赛中可以轻松击败你们的队伍。

en: It was apparent to everybody that our team was stronger.
zh: 每个人都清楚地看到我们的队伍更强大。

en: Our team is gaining ground.
zh: 我们的队伍正在取得进展。

en: Our team has the game on ice.
zh: 我们的队伍胜券在握。

en: Our team is two points ahead.
zh: 我们的队伍领先两分。

en: Our staff is eager to help you.
zh: 我们的员工渴望为您提供帮助。

en: Our soccer team beat all the other teams in the town.
zh: 我们的足球队击败了镇上所有其他球队。

en: Initially we had some problems with our computer system, but they've been sorted out now.
zh: 最初我们的计算机系统出现了一些问题，但现在已经解决了。

en: We are not short of oil in this country.
zh: 我们国家不缺石油。

en: Our club is affiliated with an international organization.
zh: 我们的俱乐部隶属于一个国际组织。

en: Our class has increased in size.
zh: 我们班级的人数增加了。

en: More than one student studies French in our class.
zh: 我们班里不止一个学生学习法语。

en: No other boy in our class is more studious than Jack.
zh: 我们班里没有哪个男孩比杰克更用功。

en: When our class performed a play, I took charge of stage effects.
zh: 我们班级演出戏剧时，我负责舞台效果。

en: Our bodies respond to our feelings.
zh: 我们的身体会对我们的感觉做出反应。

en: All our efforts were without result.
zh: 我们所有的努力都毫无结果。

en: Give us the tools, and we will finish the job.
zh: 给我们工具，我们就会完成这项工作。

en: Some members agree with us, some don't, and others haven't expressed their opinions.
zh: 一些成员同意我们的观点，一些不同意，还有一些没有表达他们的意见。

en: Famine stared us in the face.
zh: 饥荒迫在眉睫。

en: All we need now is action, not discussion.
zh: 我们现在需要的是行动，而不是讨论。

en: The God who gave us life, gave us liberty at the same time.
zh: 赐予我们生命的上帝，同时也赐予了我们自由。

en: We have a rich historical heritage.
zh: 我们拥有丰富的历史遗产。

en: We need some formal instruction in literature.
zh: 我们需要一些正规的文学指导。

en: We had no alternative but to fight.
zh: 我们别无选择，只能战斗。

en: The chairman suggested that we should discuss the problem.
zh: 主席建议我们应该讨论这个问题。

en: The chairman put forward an important plan at the meeting.
zh: 主席在会议上提出了一个重要的计划。

en: The chairman did not rule out the possibility of a disagreement.
zh: 主席没有排除意见不合的可能性。

en: The chairman called the committee to order.
zh: 主席宣布委员会开会。

en: The chairman rejected the proposal.
zh: 主席否决了这项提议。

en: The chairperson has been associated with the organization for ten years.
zh: 主席与该组织有十年的联系。

en: She attended the meeting at the request of the chairman.
zh: 她应主席的要求参加了会议。

en: I would like to nominate Don Jones as chairman.
zh: 我想提名唐·琼斯担任主席。

en: The brunt of criticism was borne by the chairmen.
zh: 批评的主要矛头指向了各位主席。

en: The chairperson cut me short.
zh: 主席打断了我的话。

en: Suppose we change the subject.
zh: 我们换个话题怎么样？

en: Let's proceed with the items on the agenda.
zh: 我们继续讨论议程上的项目吧。

en: I apologize for the delay in sending the agenda.
zh: 我为延迟发送议程而道歉。

en: The bill was eviscerated before being passed by the legislature.
zh: 该法案在立法机构通过之前被大幅修改。

en: It's a sop to Congress.
zh: 这是对国会的一种安抚。

en: Congress went into recess.
zh: 国会休会了。

en: Parliament has been dissolved.
zh: 议会已经解散。

en: Parliament has its beginnings in 14th-century England.
zh: 议会起源于14世纪的英国。

en: Do you know when the first parliament came into being?
zh: 你知道第一个议会是什么时候产生的吗？

en: The bill was passed by an overwhelming majority.
zh: 该法案以压倒性多数获得通过。

en: The chances are that the bill will be rejected.
zh: 该法案很可能会被否决。

en: The bill passed by a small majority of 10 votes.
zh: 该法案以10票的微弱多数获得通过。

en: My sister-in-law had four children in five years.
zh: 我的嫂子在五年内生了四个孩子。

en: It was just polite applause.
zh: 那只是礼貌性的掌声。

en: Try to fulfill your duty.
zh: 尽量履行你的职责。

en: Our army broke through the enemy defenses.
zh: 我军突破了敌人的防线。

en: Our troops were constantly harassed by the guerrillas.
zh: 我们的部队不断受到游击队的骚扰。

en: There is no man but loves his home.
zh: 没有人不爱自己的家。

en: Our army took the kingdom by surprise.
zh: 我军出其不意地占领了那个王国。

en: There is nothing like home.
zh: 没有什么比得上家。

en: Our house is conveniently located.
zh: 我们的房子位置很方便。

en: My house needs major repairs.
zh: 我的房子需要大修。

en: The house isn't huge and it's on about two-thirds of an acre, and when we first bought it I spent several hours every week getting the lawnmower fixed and cutting the lawn, in that order.
zh: 房子不算大，占地大约三分之二英亩，我们刚买下它的时候，我每周都要花好几个小时先修理割草机，然后再割草。

en: We are expecting an addition to our family.
zh: 我们家要添丁了。

en: There is a kitchen garden behind my house.
zh: 我家后面有一个菜园。

en: My garden is filled with sweet-smelling blooms.
zh: 我的花园里开满了散发着香味的花朵。

en: There is a small garden in front of my house.
zh: 我家门前有一个小花园。

en: Our family budget is in the red.
zh: 我们家的预算超支了。

en: If only we had a garden!
zh: 要是我们有个花园就好了！

en: At home we subscribe to the Asahi Shimbun.
zh: 我们家订了《朝日新闻》。

en: My wife holds the purse strings in our family.
zh: 我们家由我妻子掌管财政大权。

en: We substitute margarine for butter.
zh: 我们用人造黄油代替黄油。

en: We decorated the Christmas tree with lights.
zh: 我们用彩灯装饰圣诞树。

en: We keep a collie as a pet.
zh: 我们养了一只柯利牧羊犬当宠物。

en: Our team came home in triumph.
zh: 我们队凯旋而归。

en: Our team lost all its games.
zh: 我们队输掉了所有的比赛。

en: Our team lost the first game.
zh: 我们队输掉了第一场比赛。

en: Our team beat the Lions 3 to 0.
zh: 我们队以3比0击败了雄狮队。

en: We are happy to have you join our team.
zh: 我们很高兴你能加入我们的团队。

en: We are excited about having you on our team.
zh: 我们很高兴有你加入我们的团队。

en: Surrounded by the sea, Japan has a mild climate.
zh: 日本四面环海，气候温和。

en: Which do you like better, the sea or the mountains?
zh: 你更喜欢大海还是山？

en: The colors of the sea and the sky blend into each other.
zh: 大海和天空的颜色融为一体。

en: The sea is to fish what the sky is to birds.
zh: 大海之于鱼，犹如天空之于鸟。

en: You must be careful when swimming in the sea.
zh: 在海里游泳时你必须小心。

en: It is fun to swim in the sea.
zh: 在海里游泳很有趣。

en: Swimming in the sea is great fun.
zh: 在海里游泳非常有趣。

en: Some children are swimming in the sea.
zh: 一些孩子正在海里游泳。

en: To swim in the ocean is my greatest pleasure.
zh: 在海里游泳是我最大的乐趣。

en: The sea is down.
zh: 大海在下面。

en: The sea got rough, so that we had to give up fishing.
zh: 海面变得波涛汹涌，所以我们不得不放弃捕鱼。

en: Some people like the sea; others prefer the mountains.
zh: 有些人喜欢大海，另一些人更喜欢山。

en: The sea came into sight.
zh: 我们看到了大海。

en: The sea indented the coastline.
zh: 大海侵蚀了海岸线。

en: The sun rose from the sea.
zh: 太阳从海上升起。

en: Winds from the sea are moist.
zh: 来自海洋的风是潮湿的。

en: The sea is not clear.
zh: 海水不干净。

en: Turtles live to a great age.
zh: 海龟非常长寿。

en: Improved medical technology has been one of the spin-offs of the space program.
zh: 改进的医疗技术是太空计划的副产品之一。

en: There's a lot of room left for improvement.
zh: 还有很大的改进空间。

en: Show your ticket at the barrier.
zh: 请在检票口出示您的票。

en: The reformers were subject to every attack from the Establishment.
zh: 改革者受到来自当权派的各种攻击。

en: It is never too late to mend.
zh: 亡羊补牢，为时未晚。

en: I have nothing particular to say.
zh: 我没有什么特别要说的。

en: I thought it would be a good idea to get back in touch with Japanese culture and history.
zh: 我认为重新接触日本文化和历史是个好主意。

en: Some of the drivers were laughing and yelling.
zh: 有些司机在又笑又叫。

en: I can see some people walking across the street.
zh: 我能看到一些人在过马路。

en: Somebody caught me by the arm.
zh: 有人抓住了我的胳膊。

en: Some were playing tennis on the tennis court.
zh: 有些人在网球场上打网球。

en: What newspaper do you take?
zh: 你订什么报纸？

en: Wherever you go, you will find the same thing.
zh: 无论你走到哪里，你都会发现同样的事情。

en: I don't know where we'll arrive.
zh: 我不知道我们会到达哪里。

en: Getting nowhere.
zh: 毫无进展。

en: You can go anywhere you want.
zh: 你想去哪里都可以。

en: Where can I buy a ticket?
zh: 我在哪里可以买票？

en: You may sit wherever you like.
zh: 你可以随便坐。

en: Dozens of young people attended the demonstration.
zh: 几十个年轻人参加了示威活动。

en: Dozens of houses were burned down in that big fire.
zh: 在那场大火中，几十所房子被烧毁。

en: It rained after it had been dry for many weeks.
zh: 在干燥了几个星期后，下雨了。

en: Many kinds of birds live in Japan.
zh: 日本生活着许多种类的鸟。

en: Many kinds of flowers will come out soon.
zh: 许多种类的花很快就会开放。

en: She screamed with horror as someone took hold of her arm.
zh: 当有人抓住她的胳膊时，她惊恐地尖叫起来。

en: Somebody had drowned her in the bathtub.
zh: 有人把她淹死在浴缸里。

en: What time does it close?
zh: 几点关门？

en: What make of computer do you use?
zh: 你用什么牌子的电脑？

en: He had been walking for hours.
zh: 他已经走了好几个小时了。

en: After being frightened for many hours, her mother finally saved her.
zh: 在被吓了好几个小时后，她的母亲终于救了她。

en: He was worn out after hours of work.
zh: 工作了好几个小时后，他筋疲力尽。

en: I felt tired from having worked for hours.
zh: 工作了好几个小时，我感到很累。

en: It's painful to keep sitting for hours.
zh: 一直坐着几个小时很痛苦。

en: We must rescue the environment from pollution.
zh: 我们必须从污染中拯救环境。

en: We didn't help him, so he did it off his own bat.
zh: 我们没有帮助他，所以他靠自己完成了。

en: We had the luck to win the battle.
zh: 我们很幸运赢得了这场战役。

en: We set out when the rain had eased.
zh: 雨停了之后，我们出发了。

en: We eat a meal three times a day.
zh: 我们一天吃三顿饭。

en: We have three meals a day.
zh: 我们一天吃三顿饭。

en: We painted the house once, then we went over it again.
zh: 我们把房子刷了一遍，然后又重新刷了一遍。

en: We are facing a violent crisis.
zh: 我们正面临一场剧烈的危机。

en: Ever since we've been wearing clothes, we haven't known one another.
zh: 自从我们穿上衣服，我们就不认识彼此了。

en: We hit the right road in the dark.
zh: 我们在黑暗中找到了正确的路。

en: We must feel our way carefully in the dark.
zh: 我们在黑暗中必须小心摸索。

en: We were completely victorious.
zh: 我们彻底胜利了。

en: We must instill patriotism into the young people of today.
zh: 我们必须向今天的年轻人灌输爱国主义。

en: We went by bus as far as London.
zh: 我们乘公共汽车到了伦敦。

en: We are familiar with the legend of Robin Hood.
zh: 我们熟悉罗宾汉的传说。

en: We went together to Laramie, and there we parted.
zh: 我们一起去了拉勒米，在那里我们分开了。

en: We often eat fish raw.
zh: 我们经常生吃鱼。

en: We enjoyed our travels in Europe.
zh: 我们很享受在欧洲的旅行。

en: Circumstances forced us to put off the meeting.
zh: 情况迫使我们推迟了会议。

en: We were compelled to put off our departure.
zh: 我们不得不推迟出发。

en: We are all eager for him to win the Nobel prize.
zh: 我们都渴望他赢得诺贝尔奖。

en: We cannot follow your plan any longer.
zh: 我们不能再按照你的计划进行了。

en: We fought for everyone.
zh: 我们为每个人而战。

en: We all had such a good time.
zh: 我们都玩得很开心。

en: We lifted the table with our combined strength.
zh: 我们用合力抬起了桌子。

en: I lived in Nagoya for over a month.
zh: 我在名古屋住了一个多月。

en: It's not all that uncommon for people to live past the age of ninety.
zh: 人们活过九十岁并不是什么稀罕事。

en: It's not at all rare to live to be over ninety years old.
zh: 活到九十多岁一点也不稀奇。

en: When you start to look like the photo in your passport, it's time to go on vacation.
zh: 当你开始长得像护照上的照片时，就该去度假了。

en: When you start looking like your passport photo you should go on vacation.
zh: 当你开始长得像你的护照照片时，你应该去度假。

en: And nobody helped you?
zh: 而且没有人帮你吗？

en: You're an angel.
zh: 你真是个天使。

en: Thank you!
zh: 谢谢！

en: Thanks a lot!
zh: 多谢了！

en: Thank you.
zh: 谢谢。

en: Thanks.
zh: 谢谢。

en: Excuse me. Where are the eggs?
zh: 请问，鸡蛋在哪里？

en: That is a good idea.
zh: 那是个好主意。

en: Do not open before the train stops.
zh: 列车未停稳，请勿开启。

en: People who live in glass houses shouldn't throw stones.
zh: 住在玻璃房子里的人不应该扔石头。

en: Excuse me, let me point out three mistakes in the above article.
zh: 请允许我指出上面文章中的三个错误。

en: Excuse me. I'd like to point out three errors in the above article.
zh: 请问。我想指出上面文章中的三个错误。

en: It is difficult to keep up a conversation with someone who only says Yes and No.
zh: 和一个只会说“是”和“否”的人保持对话是很困难的。

en: "I can't think with that noise", she said as she stared at the typewriter.
zh: “我没法在那种噪音下思考”，她盯着打字机说道。

en: "How do you feel?" he asked.
zh: “你感觉怎么样？”他问道。

en: I can't live without TV.
zh: 我不能没有电视。

en: Life without love is meaningless.
zh: 没有爱的生活毫无意义。

en: Life without love has no meaning.
zh: 没有爱的生活没有意义。

en: Let me know if I need to change.
zh: 如果我需要换乘，请告诉我。

en: I can walk to school in ten minutes.
zh: 我步行十分钟就能到学校。

en: The family assimilated quickly into their new environment.
zh: 这个家庭很快适应了新的环境。

en: We are a family of four.
zh: 我们是四口之家。

en: Family members should not compete against each other.
zh: 家人之间不应该互相竞争。

en: May I take a few days off to visit my family?
zh: 我可以请几天假去探望我的家人吗？

en: How is your family?
zh: 你家里人好吗？

en: Please give my best to the entire family.
zh: 请代我向你的全家致以最诚挚的问候。

en: He was happy in the bosom of his family.
zh: 他在家庭的温暖怀抱中感到幸福。

en: The members of the family nursed the patient by turns.
zh: 家里人轮流照顾病人。

en: May you and your family be happy.
zh: 祝你和你的家人幸福。

en: I feel homesick when I remember my family.
zh: 当我想到我的家人时，我感到想家。

en: I'd like to call my family.
zh: 我想给家里打个电话。

en: May I ask about your family?
zh: 我可以问问你的家人吗？

en: They have time to spend with their families or to enjoy their hobbies.
zh: 他们有时间和家人在一起或享受他们的爱好。

en: My family will be away for a week.
zh: 我的家人要离开一个星期。

en: I've always wanted to go to Australia with my family.
zh: 我一直想和我的家人一起去澳大利亚。

en: I had a hand in the family deciding to move to New York.
zh: 我家决定搬到纽约，我也出了一份力。

en: It's great to have a family.
zh: 拥有一个家庭真好。

en: If it were not for my family, I would give up this job.
zh: 如果不是为了我的家人，我早就放弃这份工作了。

en: The landlord told him to leave because he hadn't paid his rent.
zh: 房东因为他没交房租，让他搬走。

en: The landlord won't permit him to paint the door red.
zh: 房东不允许他把门漆成红色。

en: The landlord told me a cock and bull story about why we didn't have heat for three days.
zh: 房东告诉我一个荒诞的故事，说为什么我们三天没有暖气。

en: If we pay the rent to the landlady, we won't have any money for food; we are between the devil and the deep blue sea.
zh: 如果我们把房租交给女房东，我们就没钱买食物了；我们真是进退两难。

en: More and more married couples share household chores.
zh: 越来越多的夫妇分担家务。

en: I had to do all the housework, but I wish I had gone to the movies or shopping.
zh: 我不得不做所有的家务，但我真希望我去看电影或购物了。

en: It's easier for me to have a job than to do housework.
zh: 对我来说，找一份工作比做家务更容易。

en: All you have to do is wait.
zh: 你只需要等待。

en: Not only you but I also was to blame.
zh: 不只是你，我也有责任。

en: Not only you but also he is ignorant of the truth.
zh: 不只是你，他也对真相一无所知。

en: He as well as you likes baseball.
zh: 他和你一样喜欢棒球。

en: Not only are you wrong, but I am wrong too.
zh: 不只是你错了，我也错了。

en: We are both to blame.
zh: 我们都有责任。

en: You are not the only one responsible for it, I am too.
zh: 不只是你对此负责，我也是。

en: Only you answered the question.
zh: 只有你回答了这个问题。

en: Only you can carry the bag.
zh: 只有你能搬动这个包。

en: What a memory you have.
zh: 你的记性真好。

en: You're the only one who can do it.
zh: 只有你能做到。

en: I'm quite all right if you have no objection to it.
zh: 如果你不反对，我就完全没问题。

en: You are the man I've been looking for.
zh: 你就是我一直在找的人。

en: You're the best man for the job.
zh: 你是这份工作的最佳人选。

en: Don't you move from here.
zh: 不许你从这里动。

en: I hadn't recognized the importance of this document until you told me about it.
zh: 在你告诉我之前，我没有意识到这份文件的重要性。

en: I was disappointed at your absence.
zh: 我对你的缺席感到失望。

en: Well may you ask why!
zh: 你问为什么，问得好！

en: I had been to the hospital before you came.
zh: 在你来之前，我去过医院了。

en: I took it for granted that you would come.
zh: 我理所当然地认为你会来。

en: I had no idea that you were coming.
zh: 我不知道你要来。

en: It doesn't matter whether you come or not.
zh: 你来不来都无所谓。

en: It does not matter to me whether you come or not.
zh: 你来不来对我来说都无所谓。

en: It's a pity that you can't come.
zh: 你不能来真是太可惜了。

en: What is it that you want?
zh: 你想要什么？

en: Why don't you eat some vegetables?
zh: 你为什么不吃点蔬菜？

en: I'm getting undressed.
zh: 我在脱衣服。

en: Creationism is pseudoscience.
zh: 神创论是伪科学。

en: "Good morning," Tom said, smiling.
zh: “早上好，”汤姆笑着说。

en: Wine is poetry put into a bottle.
zh: 葡萄酒是装在瓶子里的诗歌。

en: Wine is bottled poetry.
zh: 葡萄酒是瓶装的诗歌。

en: I've decided.
zh: 我决定了。

en: I promise.
zh: 我保证。

en: I got thirsty.
zh: 我渴了。

en: You're right.
zh: 你是对的。

en: You did it on purpose, didn't you?
zh: 你是故意的，对吧？

en: You mean you didn't tell him anything?
zh: 你的意思是说你什么都没告诉他？

en: I need your help.
zh: 我需要你的帮助。

en: Everything that is too stupid to say, is sung.
zh: 所有愚蠢得说不出口的话，都用歌唱出来。

en: It's raining.
zh: 下雨了。

en: It's too late.
zh: 太晚了。

en: I live near the sea so I often go to the beach.
zh: 我住在海边，所以我经常去海滩。

en: I need more time.
zh: 我需要更多时间。

en: My brother is watching TV.
zh: 我哥哥在看电视。

en: My younger brother is watching TV.
zh: 我弟弟在看电视。

en: A small forest fire quickly spread and became a huge conflagration.
zh: 一场小小的森林火灾迅速蔓延，变成了一场巨大的火灾。

en: I dreamed about you.
zh: 我梦到你了。

en: I was late for school.
zh: 我上学迟到了。

en: Stop criticizing me.
zh: 别再批评我了。

en: You can see the sun setting from the window.
zh: 你可以从窗户看到日落。
